Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh will be up against Zimbabwe in the 28th match of the T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, October 30 at The Gabba, Brisbane.
Bangladesh is in the fourth position in Group 2 with one win and one loss. The batsmen have disappointed in the tournament.
Star all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has scored just 8 runs in two matches so far, and the team's top scorer is Liton Das who has scored 43 runs in two matches.
Bangladesh bowlers have not performed well, with Taskin Ahmed leading the wicket-taker with five wickets but leaking runs at an economy of 10.14.
Zimbabwe registered a blistering win over Pakistan by one run. Sikandar Raza has been the standout performer with 145 runs in 5 matches and 8 wickets.
Zimbabwe's bowling attack features Blessing Mujarbani with 7 wickets, Tendai Chatara and Richard Nagarwa with 4 wickets each.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The head-to-head statistics show Zimbabwe leading 7-12 in 19 matches.
The match will be broadcasted on Star Sports and Hotstar for Indian viewers.
Probable playing XI for Zimbabwe and Bangladesh are provided, along with fantasy XI tips.
